1. General

  • K. Minogue, Politics: A Very Short Introduction. OUP Oxford, 2000.

2. STEMM

2.1. Systems Sciences

2.1.1. Complexity Science

  1. Santa Fe Institute
    • “Study: How do violent policies spread among governments? | Santa Fe Institute.” Accessed: Aug. 29, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.santafe.edu/news-center/news/study-how-do-violent-policies-spread-among-governments

    • S. F. Institute, “Emergent Political Economies and a Science of Possibility,” Medium, Apr. 19, 2022. https://sfiscience.medium.com/emergent-political-economies-and-a-science-of-possibility-6d8568c9eb63 (accessed Apr. 21, 2022).
    • cxdig, “The Complexity Global School for Emerging Political Economies,” Complexity Digest, Jul. 21, 2023. https://comdig.unam.mx/2023/07/21/the-complexity-global-school-for-emerging-political-economies/ (accessed Jul. 22, 2023).
      • “The Complexity Global School for Emerging Political Economies December 2023 | Santa Fe Institute.” https://www.santafe.edu/info/2023-complexity-global-school/overview (accessed Jul. 22, 2023).

3. Core

3.1. Principles

3.1.1. Philosophy

  1. General
    • A. Heywood, Politics. Macmillan Education UK, 2019.
    • A. Heywood, Global Politics. Macmillan International Higher Education, 2014.
  2. Philosophy
    • D. Robinson, Introducing Political Philosophy: A Graphic Guide. Icon Books Ltd, 2014.
    • D. Miller, Political Philosophy: A Very Short Introduction. OUP Oxford, 2003.
    • J. Wolff, An Introduction to Political Philosophy. Oxford University Press, 2006.
  3. Theory
    • A. Heywood, Political Theory: An Introduction. Macmillan Education UK, 2015.
    • C. McKinnon, Issues in Political Theory. Oxford University Press, 2015.
    • R. Bhargava, Political Theory: An Introduction. Pearson Education India, 2008.
  4. Misc
    • “Brian Klaas on why we choose the wrong leaders,” New Statesman, Jan. 05, 2022. https://www.newstatesman.com/encounter/2022/01/brian-klaas-on-why-we-choose-the-wrong-leaders (accessed Feb. 05, 2022).
    • M. Lane, Greek and Roman Political Ideas: A Pelican Introduction. Penguin UK, 2014.
    • G. Gaus, The Open Society and Its Complexities. Oxford University Press, 2021.
  5. Classics, Original Works
    • B. Russell, Authority and the Individual. Routledge, 2009.
    • B. Russell, Human Society in Ethics and Politics. Routledge, 2009.
    • N. Machiavelli, The Prince. Courier Corporation, 2012.

3.1.2. Political Ideologies

  1. General
    • A. Heywood, Political Ideologies: An Introduction. Macmillan Education UK, 2017.
  2. Left
    1. General
    2. Core
      • Maoism
        • General
          • J. Lovell, Maoism: A Global History. Penguin Random House, 2020.
        • Maoism In India
          • J. Lovell, Maoism: A Global History. Random House, 2019.
          • A. Roy, Walking with Comrades. Penguin UK, 2011.
          • S. Banerjee, India’s Simmering Revolution: The Naxalite Uprising. Zed Books, 1984.
          • A. M. Chenoy and K. A. M. Chenoy, Maoist and other Armed Conflicts. Penguin Random House India Private Limited, 2010.
          • N. Sundar, The Burning Forest: India’s War in Bastar. Verso Books, 2019.
          • M. Ramnath, Woodsmoke and Leafcups: Autobiographical Footnotes to the Anthropology of the Durwa People. HarperCollins Publishers India, 2015.
      • Marxism
        • R. L. Heilbroner, Marxism: For and Against. W. W. Norton & Company, 1980.
      • Anarchy
        • R. Kinna, The Bloomsbury Companion to Anarchism. Bloomsbury Publishing USA, 2012.
        • R. Kinna, The Government of No One: The Theory and Practice of Anarchism. Penguin UK, 2019.
        • N. Chomsky, On Anarchism. Penguin Books, 2014.
      • Socialism
        • General
          • “Socialism,” Simple English Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia. Oct. 18, 2023. Accessed: Nov. 09, 2023. [Online]. Available: https://simple.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Socialism&oldid=9137575

          • “Socialism.” Accessed: Nov. 09, 2023. [Online]. Available: https://dictionary.cambridge.org/us/dictionary/english/socialism
          • “Socialism | Definition, History, Types, Examples, & Facts | Britannica Money.” Accessed: Nov. 09, 2023. [Online]. Available: https://www.britannica.com/money/topic/socialism
          • K. Sears, Socialism 101. Avon, Massachusetts: Adams Media, 2019.
        • Philosophy
          • “Socialism | Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy.” Accessed: Nov. 09, 2023. [Online]. Available: https://iep.utm.edu/socialis/

        • STEMM
        • World
          • Space and Time
            • Contemporary History, Current Affairs
              • “The working class, the fight against capitalist barbarism, and the building of the World Party of Socialist Revolution <br> (Part One),” World Socialist Web Site. Accessed: Jan. 10, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2024/01/03/pers-j03.html

              • “The working class, the fight against capitalist barbarism, and the building of the World Party of Socialist Revolution <br> (Part Four),” World Socialist Web Site. Accessed: Jan. 10, 2024. [Online]. Available: https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2024/01/06/aawl-j06.html
          • Orgs

                                • Notes
                                  • "Issues of factual accuracy, justice aside, this film is not artsy and has the potential to stoke communal disharmony, and maybe even violence. Mixed populations of Hindus, Muslims, that are not very closely integrated or appropriately separated, are especially vulnerable [See Ethnic Violence, New England Complex Systems Institute. [Online]. Available: https://necsi.edu/ethnic-violence. [Accessed: 21-Mar-2020] for more]."

3.3.7. Affirmative Action

  1. General
    • “Affirmative action,” Wikipedia. Jul. 01, 2023. Accessed: Jul. 01, 2023. [Online]. Available: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Affirmative_action&oldid=1162771538
  2. Philosophy
    • “Affirmative Action (Lecture 17) | Michael J. Sandel.” https://scholar.harvard.edu/sandel/file/498256 (accessed Jul. 01, 2023).
    • R. Fullinwider, “Affirmative Action,” in The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy, E. N. Zalta, Ed., Summer 2018.Metaphysics Research Lab, Stanford University, 2018. Accessed: Jul. 01, 2023. [Online]. Available: https://plato.stanford.edu/archives/sum2018/entries/affirmative-action/
  3. STEMM
    1. i
      • Nassim Nicholas Taleb [@nntaleb], “AFFIRMATIVE ACTION The real trouble with affirmative action is that the market will end up discounting the diplomas according to the protected category, which would eventually hurt those individuals who would have commanded unconditional admission. (rephrased, generalized),” Twitter, Jun. 30, 2023. https://twitter.com/nntaleb/status/1674799066751045632 (accessed Jul. 01, 2023).
    2. 0
      • cx
      • ecol
      • syssci

              • "Hierarchal social systems continue to fail in the face of ever-increasing complexity. As NECSI research demonstrates, distributed organizational structures are needed."
